entry.title: Is Social Media Making You Depressed?

media:group.media:title: Is Social Media Making You Depressed?
media:group.media:description:
Social media connects us, but is it costing us our mental health? This video explores the link between social media use and depression, highlighting both the benefits and drawbacks of these platforms. Discover how to protect your well-being in the digital age with practical tips for mindful social media use.
Reference: Zhang C, Tang L, Liu Z. How social media usage affects psychological and subjective well-being: testing a moderated mediation model. BMC Psychol. 2023 Sep 22;11(1):286. doi: 10.1186/s40359-023-01311-2. PMID: 37737198; PMCID: PMC10515432.

entry.title: Depression, Anxiety, PTSD: What to Do When Nothing Seems to Work

media:group.media:title: Depression, Anxiety, PTSD: What to Do When Nothing Seems to Work
media:group.media:description:
This video explores what to do when mental health treatments don't seem effective. Learn how to redefine treatment success, identify key symptoms, and integrate holistic strategies such as nutrition, sleep, and daily activity to improve overall wellness.

entry.title: Can People With Bipolar Disorder Take Stimulants?

media:group.media:title: Can People With Bipolar Disorder Take Stimulants?
media:group.media:description:
Can people with bipolar disorder take stimulants to treat ADHD? This video addresses this common question, including how stimulants can affect mood stability and the careful management required to balance treatment for both conditions.

entry.title: The Worst Way to Wake Up (and What to Do Instead)

media:group.media:title: The Worst Way to Wake Up (and What to Do Instead)
media:group.media:description:
Are you waking up feeling groggy and unfocused? It might be sleep inertia! This video explains the science behind this common phenomenon and offers research-backed tips to help you wake up feeling refreshed and alert. Learn how the right alarm sounds, a consistent wake-up routine, and strategic use of light can all make a difference. Say goodbye to brain fog and hello to productive mornings!

entry.title: Top 4 Inherited Mental Health Disorders: What You Need to Know

media:group.media:title: Top 4 Inherited Mental Health Disorders: What You Need to Know
media:group.media:description:
Psychiatrist Dr. Tracey Marks explains the top 4 mental health conditions with the highest heritability (greatest genetic influence). She discusses what heritability means, the role of environmental triggers, and how knowing your family history can help you prioritize your mental health.

entry.title: Can the Keto Diet Help Bipolar Disorder & Schizophrenia?

media:group.media:title: Can the Keto Diet Help Bipolar Disorder & Schizophrenia?
media:group.media:description:
Could your diet be the missing piece in managing bipolar disorder or schizophrenia? A surprising new study investigates the ketogenic diet and its potential benefits for mental health. Learn about the science and what this could mean for treatment.
Reference: Sethi, Shebani, et al. "Ketogenic Diet Intervention on Metabolic and Psychiatric Health in Bipolar and Schizophrenia: A Pilot Trial." Psychiatry Research, vol. 315, 2024, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.psychres.2024.115866.

entry.title: Stop Fixing, Start Listening: The Power of Holding Space

media:group.media:title: Stop Fixing, Start Listening: The Power of Holding Space
media:group.media:description:
Sometimes the best way to support someone (or yourself) is to simply listen without judgment. This is called "holding space." In this video, I'll break down what holding space means, how to practice it, and why it's so powerful. You'll learn: ‚Ä¢ The difference between holding space and trying to fix problems ‚Ä¢ How to hold space for your own difficult emotions ‚Ä¢ Tips for holding space for the people you care about I'll also share my new program, Mindful Moments Weekly, which offers guided audio tools to cultivate self-compassion and resilience.

entry.title: Is Your Medication the Right Fit? ADHD, Grief, & More

media:group.media:title: Is Your Medication the Right Fit? ADHD, Grief, & More
media:group.media:description:
In this livestream, I cover a wide range of mental health topics and answer viewer questions. Here's what we discussed:
Topics: ADHD medication for children and adults, mental health effects of miscarriage, perimenopause, breast cancer, grief disorders, personality disorders, Modafinil, TMS for ADHD, childhood trauma, ecstasy for mental health, bullying, autism, jobs for therapists-to-be.
Want to ask more questions? JOIN MY MENTAL WELLNESS COMMUNITY, where I host livestreams 3 times a month. https://MentalWellnessSpace.com
Join my newsletter for weekly mental health updates http://GetMentalHealthTips.com/
:00 - Intro 1:13 - Best dose of Buspar to Effexor 6:34 - Effects of miscarriage &perimenopause women with pre-existing mental illness 12:45 - Line between mania and hypomania 18:46 - Should a seven-year-old be on ADHD medicine? 25:36 - Grief disorders, when should you seek help? 31:18 - My Mental Wellness Community behind the scenes 39:41 - Feedback and Ignoring Suggestions 41:55 - Explain Personality disorder 49:27 - Having Stage 4 Breast Cancer 54:32 - Thoughts on Modafinil 1:02:56 - Where do you go to get tested for ADHD as an adult? 1:08:01 - Thoughts on Personalities Theories 1:16:02 - Schizoid Personality Disorder 1:18:58 - Favorite Mental Health related books 1:21:19 - Can someone with ADHD be an effective therapist? 1:25:49 - "Off Label" TMS for ADHD, Is it worth it? 1:33:14 - Coping with childhood trauma 1:46:20 - Ecstasy to treat mental health issues 1:49:40 - Recommendations for adults dealing with being bullied as a child having Autistic traits 1:57:52 - Advice for jobs for someone becoming an LPC

media:group.media:description:

entry.title: Psychedelic Update: LSD On The Fastrack For Anxiety

media:group.media:title: Psychedelic Update: LSD On The Fastrack For Anxiety
media:group.media:description:

entry.title: When Your Feelings Take Control: Understanding Acting Out

media:group.media:title: When Your Feelings Take Control: Understanding Acting Out
media:group.media:description:
Do your actions sometimes seem out of your control? Find out if you're "acting out" to deal with difficult emotions. In this video, I help you understand the defense mechanism of acting out. I explain what it is, why we do it, how to recognize it in yourself and provide healthier coping skills to replace acting-out behaviors.

entry.title: Are you Projecting? How It Harms Your Relationships

media:group.media:title: Are you Projecting? How It Harms Your Relationships
media:group.media:description:
Do you find yourself misinterpreting others or blowing up over seemingly small issues? Learn what projection is and how to stop it from sabotaging your relationships.
